label: A_hR2_166_c-002
title: Rhombohedral Graphite Structure
comments:
Graphite also comes in a hexagonal form, which may be either flat \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hP4_194_bc-001}{(A9)} or buckled. When $x_{1}=1/6$ the graphite sheets are flat, however this does not produce a change in symmetry as it does in the hexagonal graphite structures. 
 All of the elements listed in the ``Other compounds'' list have experimental entries in the ICSD. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hR2_166_c-001}{$\alpha$-As ($A7$)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hR2_166_c-002}{rhombohedral graphite} (A\_hR2\_166\_c), and \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hR2_166_c-003}{$\beta$-O} have the same AFLOW prototype label, A\_hR2\_166\_c. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files. Hexagonal settings of rhombohedral structures can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
